alert.note: Alert for Caroline (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 4:53PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Caroline County through 545 PM EDT... At 453 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fort A.p. Hill, or near Bowling Green, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Fort A.p. Hill around 510 PM EDT. Port Royal around 545 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Rappahannock Academy. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
